wms_article.title: Doosan Enerbility wins Dangjin LNG storage tank order

wms_article_body.body: Doosan Enerbility said Tuesday it has won a 560 billion won ($411.8 million) contract to build three liquefied natural gas (LNG) storage tanks in Dangjin, South Chungcheong Province. The order, placed by Korea Gas Corp., covers the construction of three 270,000-kiloliter tanks, numbered 5 through 7. Doosan will be responsible for both the tank construction and the supply of ancillary facilities. Groundbreaking is scheduled for September 2025, with completion expected in December 2029. The project is the second phase of the Dangjin LNG terminal expansion, following the completion of the roof-raising work on the first four tanks in 2021. Taken together, Doosan has secured contracts for all seven tanks at the site. The company has also carried out LNG tank construction at the Incheon and Pyeongtaek terminals.
